intro: Pretrea bojeriana, commonly known as the Bojer's pretrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely known outside its native region.
